CatDescriptText: Mary Thompson, 2248 Bedford Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 14, 1957, pg. 3, with question: "Do you think that the City of Pittsburgh should own and operate its transportation system (street cars and buses)?" answer reads: "I just recently came from New York City and therefore can't say too much. But from what I've seen, I should say that the city should take the transportation system over."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Thompson wearing hat with bow, light colored shirt, and coat, holding umbrella, gloves, and handbag, standing with male journalist on right in corridor with marble and storefront windows on left
